 "Sarkar, Sumit" <sumit.sarkar@hp.com> 05/07/2004 12:02 PM

<florence.perot@hp.com> 
        Subject:        submitting patches for ia64 platform 




Hi  John, 
  
We had  downloaded "eclipse-sourceBuild-srcIncluded-I20040505.zip", built 
and tested our  changes and we are confident about our changes. 
  
I am  attaching 5 patch files with this mail as a patches_ia64.zip.  
The contents of the patches_ia64.zip file: 

1. platform-launcher_ia64.patch: In "platform-launcher/library/motif"
        a. Changed build.csh to take care of both  PA_RISC and ia64 architecture
        b. Renamed make_hpux.mak to  make_hpux_PA_RISC.mak 
        c. Created a new makefile for ia64 named  make_hpux_ia64.mak 
        d. As we need to support both PA_RISC and  ia64, we need two folders 
           named  platform-launcher/bin/hpux/PA_RISC and  
           platform-launcher/bin/hpux/ia64. Right now hpux  PA_RISC 'eclipse' 
           binary is under platform-launcher/bin/hpux folder. This  binary has 
           to be moved to platform-launcher/bin/hpux/PA_RISC folder. The new  
           eclipse binary for ia64 has to be under platform-launcher/bin/hpux/ia64  
           folder. But as these folders didn't have any files under them 
           'Team ->  Create Patch' didn't include these folder into this patch. 
           Should you think  it is a good idea to check in initial versions of 
           ia64 eclipse binary, I  have attached another patch 
           (under  platform-launcher_with_eclipse_binaries.zip) -  which has 
           PA_RISC eclipse binary moved under PA_RISC folder and our initial  
           ia64 eclipse binary under ia64 folder.
           
2. org.eclipse.swt.motif_ia64.patch: In  "org.eclipse.swt.motif":
        a. Updated  permission.properties to take care of both PA_RISC  
           and ia64 library names 
        b. Need a folder named 'os.hpux.ia64' - but as  when there is no 
           file under it, 'Team -> Create Patch' doesn't include  the folder 
           into this patch. Should you think it is a good idea to check in  
           initial versions of our shared libraries 
           (libswt-cde-motif-3050.so and  libswt-motif-3050.so) under 
           "os.hpux.ia64", I am attaching those libraries  
           (zipped as SWT_motif_ia64_libraries.zip) also  with this mail. 
           This way the folder will appear in CVS and we can later  
           check in the final version easily.  
           
3. org.eclipse.swt_ia64.patch: In "org.eclipse.swt.Eclipse  SWT PI" folder
        a. Changed build.sh to take care of both  PA_RISC and ia64 architecture 
        b. Renamed make_hpux.mak to  make_hpux_PA_RISC.mak 
        c. Created a new makefile for ia64 named  make_hpux_ia64.mak 
        d. Made changes to make_motif.xml to take care  of both PA_RISC and 
           ia64 architecture (don't know how this file is  used) 
           
4. org.eclipse.osgi_ia64.patch: In  "org.eclipse.osgi", two .java file changes 
   to add ia64  architecture 
   
5. org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility_ia64.patch: 
   In org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility", one .java file change to add ia64
 architecture

I am  working with DJ Houghton to commit the org.eclipse.core.resources.hpux 
changes. 
  
Pl.  let me know if you any questions regarding this matter. 
  
Thanks, 
sumit

SWT libraries for HP-UX IA64 version 3064

Removed the hardcoded library information from the shared libraries. Need to
add "+nodefaultrpath" in the following lines of "make_hpux_ia64.mak" file:

$(SWT_LIB): $(SWT_OBJS)
	ld +nodefaultrpath -b -z -o $@ $(SWT_OBJS) $(SWT_LIBS)

$(CDE_LIB): $(CDE_OBJS)
	ld +nodefaultrpath -b -z -o $@ $(CDE_OBJS) $(CDE_LIBS)

The "make_hpux_PA_RISC.mak" file has to have the same change.

Hi Sumit,

I am taking over this item from Christophe for the SWT team.  please forgive 
me if you have already had this discussion but I have some questions about 
this port.

SWT does not currently support a 64 bit version of motif, there are 
assumptions about pointer lengths etc in our code.  Are you running in 32 bit 
mode on the IA64 machine?

Hi Veronika,

Eclipse will be running in 32-bit mode on the IA64 machine.

Pl. let me know when you are done creating the project.

Thanks,
sumit

We need to come up with the correct name for the architecture.  "ia64" implies 
that you are running in 64 bit mode and we should reserve the name 
org.eclipse.swt.motif.hpux.ia64 for a possible future 64 bit port of motif.  
What does the OS use on the platform for the 32 bit version of the libraries? 
What does the VM report for:

System.out.println(System.getProperty("os.arch"));

System.out.println(System.getProperty("os.arch")) prints "IA64N" for 32-bit
java. For 64-bit, HP uses "IA64W" as the architecture string. "N" is for 32-bit
and "W" (Wide) for 64-bit. For now (32-bit) we can use
"org.eclipse.swt.motif.hpux.ia64" for the 32-bit SWT project name. In future, we
may want to use "org.eclipse.swt.motif.hpux.ia64w" for the 64-bit port. That
will be inlined with the HP terminology. "uname -a" returns the "ia64" as the
architecture in HP-UX IA64 machine. We have made contribution to Eclipse and we
use "-arch" as "ia64" for the IA64 port. 

Thanks,
sumit

I think the 32-bit SWT project name should be org.eclipse.swt.motif.hpux.ia64n.

We already have an ia64 project for GTK 64 bit mode which is 
org.eclipse.swt.gtk.linux.ia64 and in this case ia64 really means 64 bit 
mode.  We need to be consistent in our naming convention.

We would need to introduce -arch ia64n.

If we introduce the new arch "ia64n", we may need to update the sources, build
scripts and properties files in other packages. Is it a good time for that
change before 3.1 release?

Looking for approval from the PMC and Jim for this API addition. 

Platform/Core work includes:

Add constant to org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform and
org.eclipse.osgi.service.environment.Constants:

/**
 * Constant string (value "ia64_32") indicating the platform is running on an
 * IA64 32bit-based architecture.
 * 
 * @since 3.1
 */
public static final String ARCH_IA64_32 = "ia64_32";//$NON-NLS-1$

Modify values in the array returned from Platform#knownArchValues to include new
constant.

Veronika, Sonia, Pascal, and DJ and all feel it's a low risk change to add all 
the necessary support for IA64 32-bit builds. 

API change approved for 3.1RC3.

Yes, you should run the build yourself.  For instance download the source build
(Source in .zip) with from
http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/N20050616-0010/index.php

Follow the instructions here to set up your environment
http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/N20050616-0010/srcIncludedBuildInstructions.html

cd to the directory where you have extracted the source build
to run the build 
./build -os hpux -ws motif -arch ia64_32

If you would like to recompile the swt and launcher libraries 
./build -os hpux -ws motif -arch ia64_32 -compilelibs

You will need to use the -compilelibs flag if the libraries included in the
build are not up to date.

Once you have built and confirmed your build, you should copy your build to the
location I mentioned on download1.eclipse.org.  You should be able to login to
download1.eclipse.org using the same username and password as dev.eclipse.org. 
Actually, as you mentioned you may be able to access
/home/data/httpd/download-staging.priv/eclipse/downloads/HP from dev.eclipse.org
because they share the same distributed file system.

hth

I can't replicate this error on my machine. But of course, I don't have the
right hardware or operating system :-)  I'm using Ant 1.6.2

The eclipse compiler for our source builds is bootstrapped.

The sequences of build files that source build runs are as follows.
1. jdtcoresrc/compilejdtcorewithjavac.xml compiles the jdtcore source code and
create an ecj.jar in sourcebuildfiles/jdtcoresrc/ecj.jar
Does this file exist for you?

2. jdtcoresrc/compilejdtcore.xml compiles the jdtcore source code again using
the first ecj.jar ecj.jar to recompile the compiler source again 
there is a resulting ecj.jar in 
sourcebuildfiles/ecj.jar 
Does this file exist for you?

3. This ecj.jar is then used by the build.xml to recompile all the plugins.

It looks like it is failing when at step 2 and the sourcebuildfiles/ecj.jar does
not exist.

Created an attachment (id=23487)
eclipse compiler jar

Since bootstrapping the compiler seems to be a problem, I will attach an ecj.jar
that you can place in sourcebuildscripts/

In the sourcebuildscripts/build file, comment out the first two ant calls a the
bottom of the file that call compilejdtcorewithjava.xml and 
compilejdtcore.xml

This ecj.jar will allow you to run the build without bootstrapping the compiler.

I'll build and upload a the hpux-motif-ia64_32 RC3 build in the staging
directory on download1.eclipse.org that will be comprised of the libraries that
currently exist in the cvs repository for the fragment and launcher.  Once you
have verified it, let me know and I can moved it to the proper build page.

The ecj.jar should allow you to run the build with 
./build -os hpux -ws motif -arch ia64_32 for subsequent RC builds.

Here is the summary of the tests ran against Eclipse 3.1 GA which had reported
some failures:
1. org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui: (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=105903)
	1) testExtensionPointTask 
           - Passes when the "antui" tests are run in '-noclean' mode

	2) testProjectHelp	  
           - Passes when the "antui" tests are run in 'clean=true' mode

   These failures are not real failures. The failures are something to do with
how the tests were setup.


2. org.eclipse.jdt.core.tests.compiler:
(https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=102002)
	1) test032 - 1.4 
	2) test032 - 1.3

   Both the test cases are JDK 1.5 specific. They pass when the tests were run
on JDK 1.5. 

3. org.eclipse.ui.tests: (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=105886)
	1) drag Navigator to out of the window
	2) drag Navigator folder to out of the window
	3) drag Problems to out of the window
	4) drag Problems folder to out of the window

   The above tests are not supported in "motif" windowing system.

      5) testPushdown
	6) testNoValFont

   According to "Kim Horne" of Eclipse.org, the above tests are failing for the
following reason:
	"due to the fact that our font support on Motif allows for multiple font data
objects 
	for each font object.  Our test doesn't take that into account.  This indicates
a bad test as opposed to a 
	real failure.  I will take a look into fixing this test for 3.2."
 
      7) testOverwritePerspective
   
    From the error message "Warning: Label {A perspective with the name 'Dummy
Perspective' already exists. Do you want to overwrite?} Actual Width -> 529
Recommended Width -> 566", it is obviuos that it is not a critical issue.

4. rcp tests are not running in both PA_RISC and ia64_32. But 3.1 'rcp' is
working well in JMX Metric Builder. This is not a concern.
(https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=106018)

5. Chkpii related tests are failing.
(https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=70987)  
Chkpii tools are internal tools to Eclipse.org. These failures are ok.

Sumit's source build was failing because there was a extra . in the
build.properties for hpux-motif-ia64 in the platform-feature.  This has been
been fixed in the maintenance and HEAD streams.

Hewlett-Packard is now ready to release the Eclipse SDK 3.1.1 on HP-UX (-os hpux
-ws motif -arch ia64_32).
